definition: to convince/to subdue/to be convinced/to be bowled over
to break (e.g. stick or bone)/a loss

to break/to fracture/to snap/to suffer loss/to bend/to twist/to turn/to change direction/convinced/to convert into (currency)/discount/rebate/tenth (in price)/classifier for theatrical scenes/to fold/accounts book
to turn sth over/to turn upside down/to tip sth out (of a container)
classifier for medicine: dose/Taiwan pr. [fu2]

clothes/dress/garment/to serve (in the military, a prison sentence etc)/to obey/to be convinced (by an argument)/to convince/to admire/to acclimatize/to take (medicine)/mourning clothes/to wear mourning clothes

sentences.english: Their personality bearing and the nobility of the character compels obedience naturally.
sentences.chinese: 他們的氣質舉止和高尚的性格讓人們自然而然地折服。

sentences.english: Will business leaders succumb to these ideas?
sentences.chinese: 商業領袖們會被這些觀點折服嗎？

sentences.english: They fold their forest round their feet ; And bolster up the sky.
sentences.chinese: 他們叫森林折服於腳的周圍又把蒼天托起高高支撐。

sentences.english: And she made a variety of Sichuan dishes easily that even local chefs are impressed.
sentences.chinese: 她淡定地燒出各種四川佳餚，連當地名廚都折服。

sentences.english: All people knowing the Athletes' Village admire its building speed and quality. When Mr.
sentences.chinese: 瞭解大運村的人都爲它的建設速度和質量所深深折服。

sentences.english: And the skill of the letter lets pork flourish and tooth brush Su Shen to be convinced.
sentences.chinese: 而飛鴻的身手讓豬肉榮和牙擦蘇深爲折服。

sentences.english: I was amazed the real size of the museums and the wideness of the whole area.
sentences.chinese: 我被博物館宏大的規模和寬廣遼闊的整個面積所折服。

sentences.english: I was overawed by crazy spirit.
sentences.chinese: 瘋狂的精神讓我們折服。

sentences.english: It is more convincing to behave calmly and unhurriedly than to air aggressively.
sentences.chinese: 從容不迫的舉止比咄咄逼人的態度更能讓人折服。

sentences.english: I was impressed by the strength of their evidence that people were eating dogs at this time.
sentences.chinese: 當時的人們喫狗的證據確鑿，令我折服。

sentences.english: No one can be persuaded by sophistry.

definition: (to gasp) with admiration
to fascinate/to strongly attract/to obsess/to infatuate/to captivate/to enchant
(idiom) to gasp in amazement/to acclaim as the peak of perfection
to exclaim in admiration/a gasp of surprise
to move (to pity)/arousing (sympathy)/touching
to be full of praise (idiom)
to admire
to have a whole new level of respect for sb or sth/to sit up and take notice (of sb's improved performance etc)
to admire greatly
to be fascinated/to be captivated
ashamed of being inferior (idiom)/to feel inferior to others
to feel deep veneration for sb (idiom)
to shake/to shock/to stun/shocking/stunning/shock
to admire/to look up to/to respect sb greatly
to esteem/to admire
to conquer/to subdue/to vanquish
